task_summary: Pick (if needed) and place a grid clamp onto the board, align, release, and retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A fixed manipulator with a parallel gripper must place a small grid clamp onto a slotted grid board on the workbench. The contact sheet shows approach from the left of a SARA-branded box, vertical alignment over the board, gentle downwards motion, release, and retreat. The robot may already hold the clamp; otherwise it should locate and grasp one from a nearby tray. Precise alignment and light seating force are required to avoid tilting or bouncing of the clamp before opening the gripper and backing off safely.
preconditions: Robot powered and homed; gripper operational and calibrated
Grid board area is clear and visible to perception
Clamp either in gripper or available in the tray within reach
stepwise_plan: If not holding a clamp, search, detect, approach above, open, compute grasp, pick, verify stability, and lift
Search and detect the grid board, verify visibility, move above, and fine-align
Lower until contact with low force and place the clamp on the board
Open gripper to release, retreat vertically, and wait briefly
success_criteria: Clamp rests flat on the grid board within tight alignment tolerance
Gripper is open and empty after placement
End-effector retreats to a safe clearance height without collisions
failure_and_recovery: If object not found, rescan with grid pattern and re-detect
If grasp unstable, reopen, recompute grasp, and retry pick
If misalignment or premature contact detected, retreat slightly, realign, and attempt placement again
task_long_description.termination: Terminate after successful release and retreat wait completes or after failure handlers exhaust attempts.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Checks whether the clamp is already held to skip the pick branch.
Active search for the clamp with a grid scan.
Detect the clamp pose.
Move to a safe pregrasp height above the clamp.
Open gripper to grasp or release.
Compute a top grasp pose and store under std_top.
Execute the pick using the computed grasp.
Verify grasp stability post-closure.
Lift the grasped clamp.
Align tool yaw to the board orientation.
Search for the placement board with a grid scan.
Detect the board plane and pose.
Confirm the board remains visible before approach.
Pre-place approach above the board.
Fine alignment to the board with tight tolerance.
Controlled descent until contact is detected.
Place the clamp on the board with gentle seating force.
Release the clamp on the board.
Retreat to a safe clearance.
Brief stabilization wait after retreat.

failure_modes: Clamp not detected due to glare or occlusion
Grasp fails or clamp slips during lift
Misalignment causes edge contact or tipping
Excess force during descent displaces the clamp
recovery_strategy: Rescan with grid pattern and re-run detection
Open, recompute grasp, and retry pick
Retreat slightly, adjust yaw and re-align, then lower again
Reduce press force and repeat place after verifying visibility
assumptions: Frames predominantly depict the placement phase; the BT includes a pick fallback if the clamp is not already held
Target surface is a grid board; area_id 'board' is used symbolically
Orientation of 90 degrees matches the visual alignment of the gripper relative to the board

expected_success_criteria: Clamp is seated flat within small lateral error and yaw near 90 degrees
Gripper is open and empty, and end-effector has retreated safely
